themes.title: Celadon: A Cross-Cultural Economic Commodity
points: Discuss the significance of celadon as a luxury good in historical trade networks, connecting to economics concepts like supply, demand, and value creation.
Highlight the blue-green celadon from Korea's Goryeo dynasty (Chunk 4) and its inspiration from Chinese wares, emphasizing cultural exchange and economic interdependence.
Explore the high-quality celadon from northern Vietnam (Chunk 5) and its role in regional trade, linking to the idea of competitive advantage in economics.

themes.title: Materials and Techniques: The Economics of Craftsmanship
points: Explain the technical process of creating celadon glaze (Chunks 1 and 2), including firing techniques and the use of specific minerals, connecting to the cost of production and labor economics.
Discuss the use of stoneware and porcelain as base materials (Chunks 1 and 2), highlighting their durability and value in trade markets.
Relate the craftsmanship to the concept of artisanal economies, where specialized skills create economic value.

themes.title: Literati Landscapes: Symbolism and Cultural Capital
points: Describe the pictorial decoration resembling literati-style landscape paintings (Chunk 3), connecting to the cultural symbolism and its appeal to elite consumers.
Discuss how landscapes on celadon objects reflect intellectual and aesthetic values, tying to the idea of cultural capital in economics.
Engage the audience by asking them to interpret the landscapes and consider how art reflects societal values and economic status.

themes.title: Objectifying China: Global Influence and Identity
points: Explore how Chinese celadon influenced neighboring regions like Korea and Vietnam (Chunks 4 and 5), highlighting China's role as an economic and cultural hub.
Discuss the branding of Chinese celadon as a symbol of refinement and prestige, tying to modern concepts of branding and market positioning.
Relate the exhibit's title, 'Objectifying China,' to the idea of commodification in economics, encouraging discussion on how cultural artifacts are valued and marketed.
